comments:
I'm working with Eclipse 2.1.3 target using Eclipse  3.0. Open eclipse without
opened editors. Open class Control (SWT, not AWT), go to setEnable(...) method
and set breakpoint at line 1912 (checkWidget()) (I just double click ruler).
Error dialog comes up with a message

"Breakpoint location validation error."

Trace:
java.lang.NullPointerException
at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.actions.BreakpointLocationVerifierJob.run(BreakpointLocationVerifierJob.java:94)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:66)

Clarification required: is the breakpoint being set in Eclipse 2.1.3 or 3.0? 
(i.e. which SDK produces the error)?

I ran Eclipse 3.0. In Preferencs->Plug-in Development->Target Platform->Location
I referenced to 2.1.3 code. So 3.0 was running. The source code I explored was
Eclipse SDK 2.1.3

Please verify, Luc. Changes in BreakpointLocationVerifierJob (didn't check for 
null java element from JavaCore.create(..)).
*** Bug 69352 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
